Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Debut and Initial Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan as a circus performer and strongman, quickly escalating into a confrontation with antagonists seeking to disrupt the circus.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction at the Circus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Paul Bunyan and the audience's initial experience at the circus, setting the scene for the unfolding events.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and Giraffe Sighting

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Attack
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the escalating conflict as Paul Bunyan investigates a cry for help, leading to a direct attack on him.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Billings and 'The Strongest Man'

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and New Role
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene resolves the immediate conflict, reveals the motive behind the attack, and offers Paul Bunyan a new opportunity in the circus.

Major_Arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Revenge and Paul Bunyan's Heroism
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Matto Grasso's attempts to sabotage the circus out of revenge and Paul Bunyan's heroic actions to thwart his plans.

sub_scenes.title: Grasso's Arson Plot
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Matto Grasso's initial plan to set the circus tent on fire and Paul Bunyan's quick response to prevent disaster.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan, the Circus Strongman and Grasso's Envy
Setting the Tent Ablaze and Paul Bunyan's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Grasso's Ape Sabotage
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases Grasso's second attempt at sabotage by releasing a gorilla, and Paul Bunyan's efforts to contain the situation, leading to a chase.

narrative_arcs.title: The Big Ape is Set Loose
Paul Bunyan Grabs Gigantico and Flees

sub_scenes.title: Arena Fight and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the circus conflict with an unexpected arena fight involving Paul Bunyan, leading to Grasso's capture and Paul Bunyan's decision to leave the circus.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Tibetan Encounter
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Marco Polo's adventures in Tibet, starting with a mysterious confrontation and leading to an encounter with a talking severed head.

sub_scenes.title: Tibetan Ogress and Severed Head Discovery
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Marco Polo in Tibet and his initial encounter with potentially hostile figures, followed by the bizarre discovery of a talking severed head.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with the Awful Ogress of Tibet
Discovery and Plea of the Severed Head

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Hi-toun
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the interaction with the severed head, the gift of the dagger, and the beginning of a journey to Hi-toun.

narrative_arcs.title: The Gift of the Sacred Dagger and the Journey to Hi-toun
Arrival at Hi-toun and the City's Mourning

sub_scenes.title: Hi-toun's Trouble and the Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues in Hi-toun, revealing the city's sorrow over the missing princess and Marco's encounter with a distressed woman leading him to a suspicious castle.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo Arrives in Hi-toun and Learns of Trouble
The Grief over Princess Lotus's Disappearance
A Plea for Help and the Suspicious Castle

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Lair and Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Marco's entrapment in the witch's castle, the revelation of the old woman as an ogress, and his desperate fight for survival and eventual escape.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Summoning 'Poor Children'
The 'Poor Children' Revealed as Rats and Marco's Disgust
Confinement and the Pretense of Hospitality
Realization of Treachery and Ogress Revelation
Summoning the Monstrous Mice and Preparing for Battle
Sword Against Claws: The Fight Begins
Escape from Dungeon with Magic Knife

sub_scenes.title: Return and Reward
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the return to the princess's city, the joyful reunion with her father, and Marco's reward for saving her.

narrative_arcs.title: Unusual Mourning Decorations and Safe Return Request

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of betrayal, greed, and revenge centered around a stolen treasure from Agra, India.

sub_scenes.title: Prologue and Penal Colony
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up the narrative with a prologue about treasure and transitions to a British penal colony where the story of the Agra treasure begins.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Penal Colony and Captain's Inquiry

sub_scenes.title: The Treasure Deal and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the prisoner's offer of treasure to the Captain for help in escaping, leading to the Captain's betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Years of Revenge Planning and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Jordan's fury and vow for revenge, his years of imprisonment, and eventual release and return to England to seek out the Captain.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival in England and Renewed Vow

sub_scenes.title: Attic Betrayal and Lethal Outcome
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the midnight meeting at the Captain's house, the reveal of the treasure, and the violent betrayal leading to a lethal confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Police Investigation and Moral Conclusion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the treasure story with police intervention, the suspect's escape attempt, and a narrator providing a moral lesson.

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new story about a haunted estate and an investigator's attempt to resolve the supernatural disturbances.

sub_scenes.title: Murder and Sentencing
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene briefly introduces a violent scene and then shifts to a courtroom where Vincent Matthews is sentenced to death for murder, setting up the backstory for the haunted estate.

sub_scenes.title: The Realtor and the Investigator
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the problem of the haunted Matthews estate and the realtor seeking help from a supernatural investigator, Henry Northrup.

narrative_arcs.title: The Realtor's Problem with Matthews Estate
Concerns about Disposing of the Matthews Estate
Rumors of Vincent Matthews' Ghost and Tenant Troubles
Warning of Evil and Strange Occurrences at the Old House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Northrup entering the haunted house alone and his direct confrontation and physical struggle with the ghost of Vincent Matthews.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Assault and Claim of Superiority

sub_scenes.title: Redemption Through Forgiveness
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to a philosophical and supernatural resolution where Vincent Matthews is confronted with his past actions and finds redemption through his sister's forgiveness.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession and the Path to Salvation
Revelation of Murder and the Need for Forgiveness
The Plea for Brotherly Love and Redemption
Entering the House and Explaining Unexplained Events

Major_Arcs.title: The Ill-Fated Voyages of Henry Hudson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc narrates the historical voyages of Henry Hudson, focusing on his quest for the Northwest Passage and the tragic end to his explorations.

sub_scenes.title: The Dutch Commission
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Henry Hudson and the Dutch East India Company's proposition for him to find the Northwest Passage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Unsolved Fate of Henry Hudson
The Dutch East India Company's Proposition to Captain Hudson

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage and Hudson River
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Hudson's first voyage, the crew's discontent, and the exploration of the Hudson River, which proves to be a false lead.

narrative_arcs.title: Crew's Discontent and Exploration of Hudson River
Hudson's Failure and Return to Holland

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hudson's second voyage, the ship becoming icebound, and the eventual mutiny by the crew.

narrative_arcs.title: Another Voyage Backed and Hudson's Hope
Extreme Northerly Route and Crew's Despair

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight vs. the Tartars
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Hassan, the Arabian Knight, and his mission to rescue a kidnapped woman from the Tartar invaders, showcasing his bravery and cunning.

sub_scenes.title: The Caliph's Mission
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up the conflict with the Tartar invasion and the Caliph's summons to Hassan, tasking him with a rescue mission.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the Arabian Knight and the Tartar Threat
Summoning and Mission Briefing by the Caliph
The Rescue Mission: Kidnapped Daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali

sub_scenes.title: Journey and Encounter
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows Hassan's journey towards the Tartar camp, including his travel through the desert and an encounter with a traveler who warns him of the danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Hassan Sets Out to Confront the Tartars
Journey to the Oasis of El Sholem
Discovery of Tartar Trail at the Oasis
Encounter and Warning from a Traveler
Offering of Water and Continued Warning

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Rescue
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hassan's infiltration into the Tartar camp, his search for the captive, and the initial confrontation with Tartar guards.

narrative_arcs.title: Reaching the Outskirts and Preparing to Strike
Inside the Camp - Seeking the Daughter

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene culminates in Hassan's trial by combat against Kurgan's warriors, his victory, and the romantic resolution with the rescued woman.

narrative_arcs.title: The Signal and the Unfair Fight Begins
Victory Assured and Demands to Kurgan
